meanings.definition: The state of being uneasy or anxious.
meanings.sent1: Her uneasiness grew as the dark clouds gathered in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The uneasiness in his stomach made it hard to focus on his work.
meanings.sent3: The uneasiness in the room was so thick, you could almost touch it.
meanings.sent4: The uneasiness in her voice hinted at hidden fears.
meanings.sent5: The uneasiness of the situation lingered long after they left.

meanings.definition: A feeling of discomfort or restlessness.
meanings.sent1: The uneasiness in the air made everyone tense.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't shake off the uneasiness in her mind.
meanings.sent3: The uneasiness in his shoes made him dance around the room.
meanings.sent4: The uneasiness in the atmosphere was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The uneasiness of the unknown kept her awake at night.
